p: An intraperitoneal approach is typically used in laparoscopic parastomal hernia repair surgery, which involves the placement of an anti-adhesion mesh with a special coating that is in contact with the bowel. However, there is a risk of intestinal adhesion or fistula, and it can be life-threatening ( 19). TEP technique is already used in laparoscopic repair of many types of hernia, with good results ( 11, 20â€“ 22). We successfully separated the peritoneum by TEP endoscopy and repaired the parastomal hernia using synthetic mesh (without anti-adhesion coating). The difficulty of this operation was in the creation of extraperitoneal space around the stoma.
